instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S4: What is PP3V3_S4? The "PP3V3_S4" power rail in a MacBook is used to supply 3.3 volts to certain components when the system is in the S4 power state, also known as "suspend to disk" or "hibernate." This rail is active when the MacBook is not fully off but not in an awake state, allowing for faster startup times compared to a full boot sequence. The S4 power state means Suspend to Disk: This is a low-power state where the system context is saved to disk, allowing the system to be powered down almost entirely. Upon waking, the system can restore its state from the disk, effectively resuming where it left off..
definitions.3V3_S4: What is 3V3_S4? This is an abbreviation of PP3V3_S4, a 3.3v power rail when the machine is in an S4 state. .

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no keybord nor trackpad
threads.message:
Hi,

I have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A that doesn't recognize the keybord nither the trackpad.

I already tried with USB disk, with new trackpad and new cable and new keyboard, but same result.

Diode reading on J4800 seams ok, besides pin 8 (<SIGNAL>TPAD_WAKE_L</SIGNAL>) that has 0.002. Not sure if it is a normal reading.

Can you help?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no keybord nor trackpad
threads.message:
As per schematic 2 versions exist, <SIGNAL>TPAD_INTWAKE</SIGNAL> : SPLIT/SHARED.
If <RESISTOR>R4844</RESISTOR> is soldered (SHARED), short to ground is normal.

KB/TP work before loading macOS (boot menu)?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no keybord nor trackpad
threads.message:
Hi,

The KB/TP doesn't work at all, even before OS boots

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no keybord nor trackpad
threads.message:
Any history available?
Inspect <CHIP>U4810</CHIP> and post voltage for its pins 3 & 7 in boot menu and macOS too.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no keybord nor trackpad
threads.message:
HI,

<CHIP>U4810</CHIP> looks OK.

I can't login to macos, because keyboard doesn't work. However when powering on the macbook, with only the board on the bench I get these voltages:

Before login menu
Pin 3= 0V
Pin 7= 2.485V

After login menu:
Pin 3=2.485V
Pin 7=0V

With KB conected on the board I get those values:

Before login menu
Pin 3= 0V
Pin 7= 0V

After login menu:
Pin 3=2.485V
Pin 7=0V

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no keybord nor trackpad
threads.message:
"with only the board on the bench"
Why would we need irrelevant measurments?
Please, measure with TP connected.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no keybord nor trackpad
threads.message:
With TP/KB conected on the board I get those values:

Before login menu
Pin 3= 0V
Pin 7= 2,030V

After login menu:
Pin 3=2,034V
Pin 7=0V

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no keybord nor trackpad
threads.message:
If File Vault is not enabled, login menu is same as macOS loaded.
So be aware, put the machine in boot menu with USB KB first.

BTW, you must get opposite voltage on pins 3 & 7.
Is better to post all <CHIP>U4810</CHIP> voltages, in both cases.

2V on any output is not normal.
Be sure pin 8 gets 3.3V.
You can try changing <CHIP>U4810</CHIP>, just in case.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no keybord nor trackpad
threads.message:
File vault is disabled.

<CHIP>U4810</CHIP> voltages:

BOOT MENU:
1=2.881V
2=3.268V
3=0.002V
4=0V
5=2.879V
6=0.003V
7=2.035V
8=2.034V

With TP/KB connected I only get 2.0V on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4</SIGNAL>, and w/o the TP/KB I get 2.4V on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4</SIGNAL>, but I'm sure that a few hours ago I had 3.3V on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4</SIGNAL>

I don't understand those readings (tried with 2 multimeters), because I think that the mac shouldn't power on without <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4</SIGNAL>, but It boots

MACOS: 
1=2.881V
2=0V
3=2.0V
4=0V
5=2.879V
6=3.297V
7=0V
8=2.036V

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no keybord nor trackpad
threads.message:
<CHIP>U4810</CHIP> seems to work, but you must fix <SIGNAL>3V3_S4</SIGNAL> problem.
It is bad even without TP connected; should be 3.3V, not 2.4V, nor 2V as you've posted on <CHIP>U4810</CHIP>.
Test changing <CHIP>U8000</CHIP>.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no keybord nor trackpad
threads.message:
HI,

After replacing the <CHIP>U8000</CHIP> the TP/KB started to work again. It was that.

TKS!
